dimensions: h. with handle 17.8 cm., h. without handle 11.7 cm., max. w. with handles 9.5 cm., diam. rims 3, 3.1 cm. (7 x 4 5/8 x 3 3/4 x 1 3/16, 1 1/4 in.)
creditline: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Jerome Straka

texts.textentryhtml: Formerly Metropolitan Museum of Art 15.43.180; in 1972 was at auction at Sotheby Parke Bernet, New York, listed as Private Collector, New Hampshire, purchased by Mr. and Mrs. Jerome Straka; given to the Museum by Mr. and Mrs. Jerome Straka

In-folded, slightly flaring rim; body in the form of double tubes. Fine thread wound
spirally fourteen times around upper part of body. Double handles on either side, from lower body, to upper body, to rim. Basket handle over the top.

bibliography.boilertext: Egyptian, Coptic, Neolithic, Italic, Etruscan, Greek, Roman, Norse-Viking, Western Asiatic, Islamic antiquities: the property of various owners, including the Hagop Kevorkian Fund ... [et al.]: public auction, December 1 [1972] New York Galleries of Sotheby Parke Bernet Inc., (New York: Sotheby Parke Bernet Inc., 1972).

Egyptian, Coptic, Neolithic, Italic, Etruscan, Greek, Roman, Norse-Viking, Western Asiatic, Islamic antiquities: the property of various owners, including the Hagop Kevorkian Fund ... [et al.]: public auction, December 1 [1972] New York Galleries of Sotheby Parke Bernet Inc., (New York: Sotheby Parke Bernet Inc., 1972).

, cat. no. 162. Listed as from a "Private Collector, New Hampshire." Bought by Mr. Straka for $80.
